intro: Gymnadenia × hybrida, commonly known as the hybrid gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are tubular and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Gymnadenia × hybrida is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display.
